nodes.bodyText:
Why was this change done ?
The previous version was keeping in sync with all the fields form Elasticsearch, and now it might get out of sync in the future.
getAllMetaFields() was removed from MapperService in 7.9

You might consider using IndicesModule.getBuiltInMetadataFields() instead.
See commit: elastic/elasticsearch@70e63a3

Yes, I considered using IndicesModule.getBuiltInMetadataFields() and opted out of using it:

the Set returned by IndicesModule.getBuiltInMetadataFields() is not complete and still requires more entries to be added to it.
the Set returned by IndicesModule.getBuiltInMetadataFields() is not the same as what MapperService.getAllMetaFields() returns and requires changes to extra entries that are added to it.
the Set seems to be outdated anyway (note TODO: comment) and we should consider switching from static Set to using MapperService.isMetadataField().

FieldCapabilitiesIndexRequest has also a method to return a list of indices().
Do we need to merge the values together, similar to the above if section with SingleShardRequest ?
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/b0f402487946d52a5d54b7ad289b800b6772fd6b/server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/action/fieldcaps/FieldCapabilitiesIndexRequest.java#L79

Please check the comment below. FieldCapabilitiesIndexRequest is derived from FieldCapabilitiesRequest that process indices(), so it is not necessary to reprocess them in FieldCapabilitiesIndexRequest.

How was it taking care of sending responses before adding this catch(Ex) code ?
Will this send entire stack trace or just the message ? Is it possible that we might expose something important here ?
Since you are re-raising the Exception in here, wouldn't this cause RestController to also write the response in channel ? Do we need to do it twice ?

The exception is raised in the Runnable() submitted to generic() ExecutionService for execution and is not part of the RestController. dispatchRequest () thread stack (only submit() is part of that stack now).
